definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: How did Villa free the little girl from the snow?
sentences.chinese: 维拉是怎样将安德利亚救出雪堆的？

sentences.english: The bird had to be extricated from the netting.
sentences.chinese: 男孩从网中救出那只鸟。

sentences.english: One of the boys had to be rescued by firemen wearing breathing apparatus.
sentences.chinese: 其中一个男孩须由带着呼吸装置的消防员才能救出。

sentences.english: Dong Hongchang was shot down by the black man in prison, Liao Shaoxia was rescued.
sentences.chinese: 董洪昌被黑衣人开枪打倒在监狱中，廖少侠被救出。

sentences.english: His father and brother wept with joy as he emerged, Anatolia reported.
sentences.chinese: 当他被救出时，他的父亲和哥哥喜极而泣。

sentences.english: 'How fantastic to be up above ground again, ' said a 27-r-old survivor who was brought up.
sentences.chinese: 一名被救出的27岁幸存者说，能再回到地上太好了。

sentences.english: A man named Ma Yuanjiang was the first survivor saved on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 一位叫马远江的男人是周二救出的第一位幸存者。

sentences.english: The police battered the door down and rescued the children from the burning house.
sentences.chinese: 警察把门砸坏，于是从那着火的房子里救出了孩子们。

sentences.english: Xu Darong success arrived, will liu town and version was pulled out of the ruins.
sentences.chinese: 徐大荣成功赶到，将柳时镇和小姜救出了废墟。

sentences.english: A-ming and sweet elder sister in order to free XiaoMin, find, south to help.
sentences.chinese: 阿明和甜姐为了救出小敏，找到敦南帮助。

sentences.english: It's one of the duties of the mask's plot to get the Lady out of her seat.
sentences.chinese: 将女士从座位中救出时《面具》情节的一个职责。

sentences.english: Hagrid managed to rescue Harry before the Muggles had a chance to investigate and interfere.
sentences.chinese: 海格设法在麻瓜有机会调查干预之前救出了哈利。

sentences.english: Dongpo to rescue season often, but into house surrounded by a Chen Fu assume soon.
sentences.chinese: 东坡欲救出季常，但潜入屋不久后被陈府家丁包围。

sentences.english: I saw people taken out and put on stretchers.
sentences.chinese: 我看到有人从房子里救出，然后送上担架。

sentences.english: I rescued my belongings from the flood.
sentences.chinese: 我把财物抢救出来，免遭洪水淹没。

sentences.english: The prince rescued the beautiful maiden from the monster.
sentences.chinese: 王女由怪兽手外救出美丽的少女。

definition: to rescue/to help out of difficulties/to save the situation
to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
to come to the aid of/to save/to rescue from danger/to relieve
to get away/to escape (from obligations)/to free oneself/to disengage
to get into difficulties/to meet with danger
